intro: Ludwigia brachycarpa, commonly known as the short-fruit Ludwigia, is a species of flowering plant in the Onagraceae family. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is often found in wetland habitats. The plant is characterized by its succulent, cylindrical stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically orange or red, with four petals and prominent stamens. It is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in aquatic or bog gardens.
